item.title: Why's it doing this when copying codes?
item.dc:creator: @Cowarooroo Cowarooroo
item.description:
@Cowarooroo wrote:

[quote=“Rixxx, post:2, topic:356730”]Tabs instead of spaces would be better:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("item")) { if(!inCombat){ String[] args = playerCommand.split(" "); if (args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); for(int element : noSpawn) { if(element == newItemID) { c.sendMessage("You may not spawn this item."); return; } } if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) { c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { c.sendMessage("No such item."); } } else { c.sendMessage("Use as ::item 995 200 for example 200 gp"); } else { c.sendMessage("You can't do that while in combat!"); } }

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”)) {
if(!inCombat){
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
for(int element : noSpawn) {
if(element == newItemID) {
c.sendMessage(“You may not spawn this item.”);
return;
}
}
if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“No such item.”);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Use as ::item 995 200 for example 200 gp”);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“You can’t do that while in combat!”);
}
}[/quote]
It changes to spaces automatically. Anyway… that has nothing to do with the fact of why it groups everything for me =p.

Read full topic
item.source: Why's it doing this when copying codes?

item.title: Why's it doing this when copying codes?
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Tabs instead of spaces would be better:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("item")) { if(!inCombat){ String[] args = playerCommand.split(" "); if (args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); for(int element : noSpawn) { if(element == newItemID) { c.sendMessage("You may not spawn this item."); return; } } if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) { c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { c.sendMessage("No such item."); } } else { c.sendMessage("Use as ::item 995 200 for example 200 gp"); } else { c.sendMessage("You can't do that while in combat!"); } }

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”)) {
if(!inCombat){
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
for(int element : noSpawn) {
if(element == newItemID) {
c.sendMessage(“You may not spawn this item.”);
return;
}
}
if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“No such item.”);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Use as ::item 995 200 for example 200 gp”);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“You can’t do that while in combat!”);
}
}

item.title: Why's it doing this when copying codes?
item.dc:creator: @Cowarooroo Cowarooroo
item.description:
@Cowarooroo wrote:

Ok so I often copy stuff out of code boxes…

Like this one

but when I do it’s all jumbled.

Example.
I can copy

if (playerCommand.startsWith("item") && c.playerRights >= 0) { if(inCombat == false){ String[] args = playerCommand.split(" "); if (args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); for(int element : noSpawn) { if(element == newItemID) { c.sendMessage("You may not spawn this item."); return; } } if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) { c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { c.sendMessage("No such item."); } } else { c.sendMessage("Use as ::item 995 200 for example 200 gp"); } else { c.sendMessage("You can't do that while in combat!"); } }

And it will turn into //// when I paste it.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("item") && c.playerRights >= 0) {        if(inCombat == false){                String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");                if (args.length == 3) {                        int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);                        int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);                        for(int element : noSpawn) {                                if(element == newItemID) {                                        c.sendMessage("You may not spawn this item.");                                        return;                                }                        }                        if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {                                c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);                                } else {                                c.sendMessage("No such item.");                        }                } else {                       c.sendMessage("Use as ::item 995 200 for example 200 gp");                } else {        c.sendMessage("You can't do that while in combat!");        }}

Read full topic
